author: Dr. Robert Kim

sections.title: Secondary Diagnoses
sections.content:
1. Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus
2. Chronic Kidney Disease Stage 3b
3. Heart Failure with Reduced EF
4. Atrial Fibrillation
5. Hypertension

sections.title: Hospital Course
sections.content: Patient was admitted for volume overload and treated with IV diuretics. Responded well to treatment with 6 liters of diuresis over 3 days. Symptoms improved, weight decreased from 101 kg to 97 kg. Renal function remained stable. No arrhythmias on telemetry. Patient educated on diet and medication compliance.

sections.title: Discharge Instructions
sections.content:
1. Take all medications as prescribed
2. Weigh yourself daily
3. Follow low-sodium diet (<2g/day)
4. Limit fluids to 2 liters daily
5. Call if weight increases >3 lbs in a day or symptoms worsen
6. Follow up with appointments as scheduled

sections.title: Follow-Up Appointments
sections.content:
1. Primary Care: 1 week
2. Cardiology: 2 weeks
3. Nephrology: 4 weeks
